entities: PHB production, capability of nitrogen fixation. sMMO only, growth reduction at NaCl conc. above 0.7% ( w / v ). Optimum methanol conc. between 0.1 and 1% ( v / v ), capability of nitrogen fixation.

succinate, capability of nitrogen fixation. sMMO only, growth inhibition by NaCl conc. above 0.8% ( w / v ), ability of growing on methane and methanol, best growth at methanol conc. of 0.5 - 1%( v / |
Dam et al. (2013), Kalyuzhnaya et al. (2019), Vorobev et al. (2014)
pMMO only, ability of growing on methane, methanol and acetate, growth inhibition with 0.3% ( w / v ) NaCl, growth support at methanol conc. below 0.1% ( v / v );
Baani and Liesack (2008), Dam et al. (2012)
Chen et al. (2010), Dunfield et al. (2003)
Bordel et al. (2019a), Bordel et al. (2019b), Lindner et al. (2007)
pMMO and sMMO, capability of oxidizing aliphatic and aromatic compounds, ability of growing on methane and methanol, PHB production, capability of nitrogen
pMMO only, possession of genes for ammonia assimilation and nitrogen fixation.
pMMO only, facultative methanotroph, ability of growing on acetate or ethanol, diverse nitrogen metabolism capabilities
Auman et al. (2001), Kenney et al. (2016)
pMMO only, high tolerance of ammonium, capability of nitrogen fixation
sMMO only, facultative methanotroph, ability of growing on methane, and one - carbon and multi - carbon substrates such as acetate, pyruvate, propane, and
del Cerro et al. (2012), Kalyuzhnaya et al. (2019), Pieja et al. (2011)
pMMO and sMMO, well-established catalysis for PHB production, epoxidation, ability of degrading chlorinated aliphatic hydrocarbons, production of
pMMO and sMMO, production of methanobactins and capability of nitrogen fixation.

pMMO only, growth inhibition by NaCl conc. of 0.5% ( w / v ), ability of growing on methane and methanol, growth support at methanol conc. below 0.05% ( v / v ), capability of nitrogen fixation, PHB production.
Dam et al. (2013), Dedysh et al. (2015)
pMMO only, no requirement of NaCl for growth, PHB production, capability of nitrogen fixation
Oldenhuis et al. (1989), Stein et al. (2010), Whittenbury et al. (1970)
fixation pMMO only, PHB production, capability of nitrogen fixation
